summary: A copy of the Gospels in English. Royal 1 A. xiv is textually related to Hatton 38 either by being its exemplar or by sharing a common copy of the text. Both manuscripts relate, textually, to Oxford, Bodleian, Bodley 441. For an excellent discussion of the textual tradition of the Old English Gospel see Liuzza (1994, pp. xliii-lxxiii).

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'Initium sancti evvangelii secundum marcum. Ecce mitto | angelum meum ante faciem tuam. qui preparabit | uiam tuam ante te;'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Her ys Godspelles angin; halendes cri | stes godes sune'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Hyo þa fulfoed bodeden sƿa ƿid sƿa al. Þas | hlafordes ƿeorces ˥ his bispelles fulfellende mid | felgenden tacnen. Amen'

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: CUL Ii. 2. 11; Bodley 441; CCCC 140; Hatton 38 and Beinecke 578.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Verse 16:14-20 (explicit) textually different from the one edited in Liuzza 1994 but the same as Hatton 38.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'Liber generationis iesu christi filii dauid filii | abraham.'

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'Her anginð; matheus boc þas | halgan godspelleres.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Soðlice ƿel is to understanden þæt | æfter matheus gerecednysse her his on cneor | nesse boc'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: '˥ læreð þæt hyo | healdon ealle þa þing. þe ic eoƿ be bead ˥ ic | heo mid eoƿ ealle dagas oððe ƿeoruld enð (addition: ) unge.' | Amen

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: CUL Ii. 2. 11; Bodley 441; Otho C. i (text partly missing due to fire); CCCC 140; Hatton 38.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'Nu ðe ƿillað her eoƿ areccen'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'lucas boc Ðas halgan godspelleres. for ðan | ðe ƿytodlice manega þohte þare þinge race geendebyrden'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Soðlice he gelædde hyo ut on bec hanian ˥ he | bletsade hyo his handa upahafenum. ˥ hit ƿæs ge | ƿarden'

items.locus:
Fol. 133v/14 following from the main
                                          text

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: 'þæt he hyo ge blestode. he ƿente fram he | om ˥ he smat in to heofene. And hyo þa gebidden | de gecynden in to ierusalem mid muchelere blis | se. ˥ ƿæren efre in þare temple heriende and blet | siende god. AMEN'

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Verse 23:51-53 is written at the end of the gospel by a later hand. It is textually different from the one edited in Liuzza 1994, but the same as Hatton 38, in which it is included by the main hand who copied the manuscript.

items.locus: Fol. 134r/19 on the ruled blank recto
Fol. 134r/22 on the ruled blank recto

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: 'Sancte GREGORIES se mid grecum crissostomas ys haten'

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'Her onginð þæt | godspell þe Iohannes se godspellere ge | ƿrat on pathmos þam eigtlande.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Ƿitodlice oðre mane | ga þung synt þe se hælend ƿorhte gif ða ælle'

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: CUL Ii. 2. 11; Oxford, Bodleian, Bodley 441; CCCC 140; Hatton 38.

items.locus:
Fol. 173v/5 following from the main
                                              text

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'ƿritene be heom sylfe ƿæren. ac syo ƿerld be clyp | pen ne mihten þa ƿriteres þe hit ƿriten scolden on bokeN'

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The end of verse 21:25 is written at the end of the gospel by a later hand. These verses are textually different from the one edited in Liuzza 1994, but the same as Hatton 38.

notes.head: Overview:
notes.body: Overview: Ruling in pencil on the hair sides, writing on top line. Single bounding lines. See diagram.

accompanying: Fols 1, 2 and 175 are medieval binding-leaves from a twelfth-century missal. Fol. 1 was pasted down. Texts refers to the services for the Vigil of the Nativity, fol. 175rv, Christmas fol. 2rv and Stephen and John fol. 1v (see Liuzza 1994).

history.origin: On fol. 3r there is a medieval press mark 'D xvi Gra IIII', which refers to the pressmark used by the library of Christ Church, Canterbury.
history.provenance: It is probably the 'textus iv evangeliorum anglice' listed in Cambridge, CUL Ii. 3. 12, which started to be compiled ca. 1170 (James 1912, p. 51).
history.acquisition: Belonged to John Lumley (c.1533-1609) and is listed in the catalogue of his collection, 1609. Lumley passed the manuscript to Henry, Prince of Wales (1594-1612). His collection became part of the Royal library. Presented to the British Library by King George II in 1757 as part of the Old Royal Library (British Library Catalogue).

admin: Manuscript described by Orietta Da Rold with the assistance of Helena Cooper, Owen Roberson and Hollie Morgan (2010; 2013).
